Reviews.Content: this tv is so amazing!!!! We switched from a 42" tv, to this 70" tv. What a difference. Now, we want one of these for the bedroom, because it makes all out other tvs look pitiful< I recommend this tv 100%

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Richard H.
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for four months.  Clear picture and reliable product. Sound is weak as expected. Really love it.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Aquos TV
Reviews.Author: jt
Reviews.Content: just as advertised. works perfectly . The picture is out of thsi world once you fine tune it. So many bells and whistles for the price. Like having a huge PC montor and I couldnt be more pleased. Shipped and arrived quickly

Reviews.Title: Looks great!

Reviews.Title: good price

Reviews.Content: have been contemplating buying a sharp tv for a while;  works great and really good sharp picture; have some trouble getting on internet, but not TV's fault

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Rod
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV for the price. Very slim and fairly easy to use. I recommend this TV highly.

Reviews.Title: We love our new TV!
Reviews.Author: D. Coleman
Reviews.Content: We recently upgraded to this TV from a 42 inch old school plasma. It was a big decision for our family and we don't regret it one bit. The picture quality is amazing and it looks good on a credenza or hung on the wall. I took the advice of removing the soap opera effect (thank you to the previous reviewers) and it looks great, however by leaving that alone sports still look incredible. After researching several TVs it was between this and the Vizio. I know the Vizio is a great TV as well but we went with the Sharp Aquos based on reviews of reliability and access to customer service, if we ever need it. The smart TV features are neat - feels like home with the rest of our household technology (phones, tablets, etc.) I'm not a "techy" but can definitely say this is a good TV if you are on the fence about it.

Reviews.Title: Solid Value
Reviews.Author: Dalip Singh
Reviews.Content: Color accuracy appears a little saturated but consider it excellent for the price.  Would recommend to anyone looking for a reasonably valued, large SMART TV

Reviews.Title: Perfect product !!!!
Reviews.Author: oli
Reviews.Content: Received my TV all the way in HAITI, everything was great , TV sound of TV is not the best but added a 9.1 LG surround and made it lol. Love it

Reviews.Title: Great TV with room to improve.
Reviews.Author: trevorj
Reviews.Content: First I just want to say how great Amazon has been through this tv purchase. I was a little hesitant purchasing such a large item from anyone other then a local brick and mortar just in case there was something wrong. Well the first tv purchased arrived with a crack on the bottom plastic by the speaker. They sent out a replacement which arrived a week later. Unfortunately i noticed a narrow block of what appeared to be dead pixels along the side of the screen that was about an inch long. The second tv was replaced and received this one which is great. Through the process the price had dropped and they credited me that as well.As far as the actual tv I've owned it for several months now. For the most part I love this tv although there are a few hiccups. I think the picture quality is pretty good for such a large screen at this price point. You just have to be aware of what the actual source material is. The tv isn't a magician it's not going to make standard definition look spectacular. I do occasionally see a glimpse of the soap opera effect but it's not horrible over all. The screen is matte which does a great job of not reflecting the light in our living room. Our previous tv was a Samsung 55" LCD which had a glass front panel and was horrible in the middle of the day to watch. The smart tv features are pretty basic but I wasn't really looking for that because we have a Apple TV and PS3. I actually was looking at the model below 550 but this was the same price and it had wi-fi to do any of the firmware upgrades. The one thing it's missing is Amazon Prime video which would make it great. I can't say much on the audio as I've only heard it through the tv speakers  few times but I'd suggest a surround system because it's a night a day difference. Overall glad I made this purchase and great experience.

Reviews.Title: The Right TV
Reviews.Author: Peggy L. Duckworth
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research on LED HDTV's and narrowed it down to two but I really needed a matte screen since my room is flooded by daylight.  The Sharp was the best choice.  Great picture.  This is the second TV I've purchased from Amazon and I couldn't be any happier with their service.

Reviews.Title: Samsung has nothing on Sharp
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Porter
Reviews.Content: Our new 70" Sharp looks every bit as good as our old 46" Samsung.  The Samsung goes in the bedroom.  The bedroom 40" TCL goes in the guest room and the 32" Phillips moves to my wife's office.  Diverse collection with all performing welI would recommend each depending on what size you need and what you want to do with it.  We only hooked up the Cable DVR and the Sony Blue Ray w/wifi to the Sharp--so we have not used the Wifi on the TV.  It's really just used as a monitor as we also have Onkyo 7.1 w/Procinema 800 system for sound.  The Onkyo amp is older and I would NOT recommend a new Onkyo amp.Update.  The old Onkyo was not up to the task.  We did use HDMI cabling but it was not pass thru so cabling was everywhere!..  We have replaced the amp w/Yamaha RX-v473 (yes it is an older model) but we have one cable to Sharp and everything else goes to the amp.

Reviews.Title: Great Value, Great Features
Reviews.Author: Bryan Geruntho
Reviews.Content: Have had it for 3 weeks so far...very satisfied.  Tons of features.  I'm using 20MPS cable modem, all smart features work great.  Blu-Rays look fantastic...follow others' instructions on getting rid of the SOE.  No idea about audio as I have it hooked to a full 7.2 sound set-up.  Built in browser is a little awkward to use, but that's not why I got the TV...I have enough devices for that.  If you're on the fence, I say go for it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Macjoubert
Reviews.Content: Got this TV over the weekend, and so far I am happy with my purchase.A few things that pop out.They dont mention this in the instructions, but you may have problems connecting to your WIFI based on your wireless router encryption. I painfully tried everything under the sun to finally get this working and not having to use the ungodly LAN cable.Basically the TV will connect only to WEP, WPA (TKIP encryption) and WPA2 (AES encryption). I played around the various modes until WPA2 worked. Problem with WEP is , with Verizon FIOS it dramatically reduces your speed 50% so you might want to be careful choosing this option.Customer service was okay but the only key word she said was AES , thats how I started localizing the problem until it was resolved.The TV itself is very sharp (no pun intended lol) and I especially liked the Movie picture setting, watching Game of Thrones has never been better, especially since you can see all the different terrains in fantastic splendor in the same show.Ill update through the year.

Reviews.Title: I am not an expert but I think it is great
Reviews.Author: Kira
Reviews.Content: I have had the TV for a month or so now. It looks great to me. I don't like the normal mode which is much too bright for my tastes. Once it was changed to game mode though the flesh on people's faces looked much more normal.The TV weighs nothing at all and is easy to move around. The sound is awful, but I don't count that against the TV since it doesn't seem like any manufacturer puts decent sound in these LCD panels anymore.The apps that come with the TV are nice. I tried netflix for the first time because there is a netflix app on the TV. The web browser is kind of useless because using the remote as a keyboard will drive you crazy. Hooking it up to the internet was trivial.The TV seems like it has been there forever and is part of the house, so I guess that means that I like it so much I don't even think about it anymore!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Eugene E Noyes
Reviews.Content: Arrived 6 days ago via Pilot shipping.  The shippers did a great job, packaging show no damage and TV was in perfect condition out of the box.  The driver unboxed and tested the TV and the remote while I watched.  After I installed the small stand and placed the unit on the TV table and hooked up the set top box; we turned  it on a everything looked quite good.  I used the setting from the CNET review, made 1 small adjustment to the hue.... and WOW - it has and outstanding picture.OTHER:  Amazon lowered the price $65 after the TV shipped and when I called for a price match I request was handled prompted and I left the call a happy guy.If anything changes in the next 30 days or so I'll amend this review, ut right now I could not be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: great at first
Reviews.Author: Greg Miller
Reviews.Content: When I first bought this TV I loved it, sound was a little inconsistent, but other than that VB pretty good. After owning just under two years pixels started burning out. If.bb you did not buy extended warranty, you might as well throw away and buy new according to sharp. It is the last sharp product I will ever buy.

Reviews.Title: Great 70" TV
Reviews.Author: luetk01
Reviews.Content: Picture is amazing (once you turn off the automotion feature) and movies/sports look great on the tv. Sound wasn't great but didn't matter to me because I hooked it up to a soundbar. My only compliant is that the wifi feature doesn't work the best. I think the wifi from my other devices (PS3 and bluray) interfere with it, which the manual does say is possible. I haven't tried disabling those, but I don't really plan on using the internet features much.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: WORKOUT JUNKY
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Sharp I have in my house.  They all have great picture quality.  I see there are some reviews on here that claim the picture quality is poor.  I seriously have no idea what they are talking about, another thing to keep in mind is that some cable providers make you purchase HI Def channels, (DISH is one of them) if this is the case then the TV wont display in Hi Def.  Another thing to keep in mind, I have DISH and only the TV the is directly connected to the box will get the Hi Def, the other TV will not since the box controls 2 TVs.  I am just putting this out there for people to keep in mind when it comes to the other reviews, because the picture quality could be circumstantial, or they are TV snobs.... If you are not picky, and just want a quality picture without paying a higher price for like with Samsung or LG.... and get the smart TV option for less, go with Sharp.

Reviews.Title: Audio and Video is out of sync.
Reviews.Author: A. McGonigle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV less than a week ago.  The audio has about a 1 or 2 second delay behind the video.  I didn't want to go through the hassle of returning it immediately, so I contacted Sharp customer service.  They took me though the process of resetting the TV (which takes two people).  A couple of hours later I noticed the same thing happening again.  I gave this an extra star because the problem is intermittent and only happens for a short time before it corrects itself. I'm going to return it and buy a Vizio along with a 5 year warranty for the same price.  After reading reviews on these large screen LEDs I've come to find out that this issue is not exclusive to Sharp TVs.Update...I did purchase the Vizio as stated above and am now having the same problem.  Therefore I changed my review to 5 stars because the issue is not with the TV.  I'm still trying to determine what the cause is.

Reviews.Title: Made Wife Happy
Reviews.Author: K. Schultz "Grandpa"
Reviews.Content: She can see the fine print on the screen now - I do not have to tell her what the scroll on the bottom is reading.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic at any price unbeatable at what I paid
Reviews.Author: Stephen O. Huntley Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV a few months ago and wanted to use it enough to review it fairly. I is a wonderful TV clear picture very clear 120hz is more than enough today. I have mine hooked up to multiple inputs xbox one, xbox 360, cable, bluray all look stunning, almost not motion blur even during fast pace gaming.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: joesupra
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV based on the reviews and the price for a set this large. Unfortunately the sharpness (no pun intended) or clarity of the picture when compared to my four year old 55 inch Samsung is obvious. The best way to describe it it inconsistent. Sometimes the picture looks better then other times. It's almost as if I'm willing myself to believe the picture is as rich as the Samsung when I know it's not. Sometime cheap is expensive as I will be stuck with this TV for a while. Spend the extra bucks go for a Sansung or Sony. Even my LG in the lanai is better then the Sharp.

Reviews.Title: BEST TV ON THE MARKET. JUST DONT BUY IT FROM
Reviews.Author: glenn frerker
Reviews.Content: After previously buying the 80 inch from local retailer. I looked around to find this 60 for the best price for in our sunroom. after checking around I found them cheaper then amazon, but decided to order from them because I thought they were more trusted. The picture is amazing and clear, and this tv is fairly easy to navigate. setup was no problem as directions get you up and running in no time. I love sharp tvs and will only buy them. However, I will not be trusting amazon for any more purchases. I was guaranteed a delivery of December 6th, after not hearing from delivery company I called them to find out that amazon didn't ship it as promised and it wouldn't even get to the local warehouse until late December 6th. If this is what they do with their guarantee shipping date I will not be buying from them ever again. Great tv. just don't buy it from here

Reviews.Title: great TV, but where is the user guide for the remote?
Reviews.Author: auroragb
Reviews.Content: The picture is excellent on this TV. I got this TV Friday and was able to set it up pretty quickly. The manual didn't give too much information. My biggest frustration is that this comes with a universal remote, but the remote doesn't have a users guide. So, the remote is useless except for controlling the TV. This is extremely annoying. Would have been at least a 4 star or 5 star otherwiseWith regards to sound, maybe I'm just not an audiophile or maybe my media doesn't have extreme demand on dynamic range, but it sounds just fine to me. Volume level is fine and not tinny. While I have heard better, but it serves fine for TV watching. To be fair, bass is a bit weak, but I'm not expecting TV speakers to shake the floor. So, I guess if you like watching a lot of action movies, be prepared to buy dedicated speakers. But that's kind of obvious, isn't it?

Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: Great Customer Service. I had a miscommunication with the delivery time/date and the company was quick to resolve the problem  much to my delight.  I would order again from this supplier.  TV came in perfect condition and was exactly what I had hoped for!  Great picture and quality.

Reviews.Title: Very Smooth Delivery from Amazon
Reviews.Author: ESVK "SVK"
Reviews.Content: I am an avid Amazon shopper, but I was a little hesitant to buy such a large electronic piece via freight shipping.  But, I decided to give Amazon a try and everything went very smoothly.  I am a prime member and could have had the TV in two days, but I elected to set up a time later in the week when I knew someone would be home.  The freight company showed up with the TV at the very start of the 3 hour window and brought the unit all the way into the house.  They also called me about 20 mins beforehand to let me know they were on the way.The TV is great.  I had viewed it at a Costco before I purchased it so I had an idea as to what I was getting.  The unit weighs about 100 lbs and my wife was actually able to help me lift it onto the stand temporarily.  I then bought a retractable mount and put it on the wall.  It really isn't that hard to do and you can DIY with the weight of this TV if you have someone to help you.  Also, I highly recommend getting a retractable mount - even though they are a little more expensive.  Mount-It! LCD TV, LED TV Wall Mount Bracket with Full Motion Swing Out Tilt & Swivel Articulating Dual Arm for Flat Screen Flat Panel LCD LED Plasma TV and Monitor Displays That way you can easily pull it out from the wall to get at the connections in the future.

This television popped up at the top of my choices.  Being a smart shopper I had already done some research on pricing at the Clubs and other big box retailers. EXCELLENT PICTURE, VERY CLEAR YOU CAN SEE SCARS AND PIMPLES ON SOME OF THE FACES. FITS WELL WITH OUR DECOR.  WE ARE HAPPY WITH OUR PURCHASE

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Q. Jurin
Reviews.Content: After extensive research, I finally settled on this TV. The reviews were good, and I was very excited to receive this thing.When the TV finally arrived, I eagerly unpacked the TV from the box and began to set everything up. I couldn't wait to turn it on. It was beautiful out of the box--I was sure it would be spectacular once displaying its picture. So I'm setting everything up and get to the part where I need to arrange the stand. I get the metal pieces that connect the base to the TV, and realize I don't see the screws that fasten those plates to the TV. I check the box again. I check all the styrofoam pieces. I check the floor. I check everywhere. But no screws. Since I wasn't going to wall mount the TV, the stand was my only option, so I was stuck with no TV, and really nowhere to put the 70" screen.Frustrated, I called the Aquos product support, and they quickly rogered up to sending the screws. Now, after spending all this money on a TV, I expected to hear "our fault, so sorry, these are coming to you overnight, you should see them tomorrow." Instead, when I inquired how they were being shipped, I was told normal ground. I almost blew my top, but calmly asked to speak to a supervisor. I wound up having to call back and waste a day. When I finally did speak to a supervisor, she quickly agreed to overnight the screws. So, I'm taking a star off for hit and miss product support, and lack of screws in the first place. To the guy or girl whose job it is to get those screws in the boxes--dude, you had ONE JOB TO DO!The TV itself, once I finally got it secured to the stand (a two-person job, is awesome. There was some motion jitter at first during sports and scene panning, but we got used to it. After making the setting adjustments to get rid of the soap opera effect, we have completely enjoyed the TV. Sadly enough, one of the features that tipped the balance for me between this and other contenders--the ability to use the TV like a digital picture frame--is a feature that my wife will not let me use, since she doesn't want people looking through our window while we're not home and realizing we have a nice TV. Come on!Anyway, my only other minor complaints are the sound (adequate, but not great, but we expected that since it's a well-known issue), and the clunkiness of the web interface. Not much you can do about that, though. Bottom line: Love the TV and would absolutely recommend it.

The only issue what i have with all LED is when on some movies or tv series the quality of image is extremely good and sometimes you can see some errors and mistake on movies and tv series, this specific effect i don't like, but on sport is awesome!! Reviews.Content: I never seen liquid crystal before. It is very clear and it arrived with no damage. It was easy to assemble and sometime I can tell it is a liquid.

Reviews.Content: Love our new 70 inch TV. Great picture and features. I do recommend getting a sound bar but not necessary depending on size of your space. There are several Youtube videos on line by Sharp that explain how to setup your settings including internet/wifi. Overall great initial quality and product.

Reviews.Title: Picture and sound reset every hour or so
Reviews.Author: Kristen Ecklund
Reviews.Content: The first tv we ordered came damaged by the shipper so we had to send it back.Second tv came, set up was not that great, very complicated for a smart tv.  We can't use an optical cable with the sound bar we have, actually we can use the Samsung and had to stop using it all together we just could not get them to work together.The picture is excellent, sound ehhhhh, not great. The picture setting are very dark so darker shows and movies are very difficult to watch, still configuring those settings.The TV picture goes out ever hour or so, sound drops first, then 3 seconds later the picture goes black, the Sharp logo shows up and all goes back to normal.  It's unfortunate that we've learned to tolerate it.  If anyone has any idea what that is, by all means comment.As with other tvs the soap opera effect takes some getting used to, but can be adjusted.  Overall a decent tv, not sure i would buy a Sharp ever again. Way too much hassle compared to previous TVs (Phillips, Sony).

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Island Tractor
Reviews.Content: Yes, there are Samsung models that are better but they cost at least $500 more.  This TV is excellent generally and a superb bang for the buck (well under a grand from a major warehouse store).  Setup was easy though there could have been better instructions on setting up wifi/internet (use the manual mode).  Picture quality is excellent though I did note that more expensive Samsungs had even better picture quality when displayed side by side with this set but at home it is perfectly excellent.  Way better than my 5yo Sony.  No disappointment at all with picture quality.  I'm not so impressed with the "smart" features although they do work.  I will probably end up getting an Amazon Fire to take advantage of Prime material anyways so don't expect to use the native smart features anyway.Again, there are smarter and better sets out there (mostly Samsung models) but none of those comes close to this set in bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: Great tv

Reviews.Content: No complaints what so ever. One of the best rated led's of 2013 through various test sites and shows y.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, poor digital out capabilities
Reviews.Author: Tony Clark
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV when it was on sale for $999.00.  This was to replace our old 42" plasma TV.  The picture is amazing.  The TV is very lightweight and thin and even though I doubtfully will use the Smart TV features, since this was the same price as the non-smart TV, I opted for this one.  I have a Bose 3-2-1 surround and along with this TV I have an XBox 360 and a Playstation 3 hooked up to it.  The PS3 is my BluRay player as much as my main gaming system. I also have DirecTV.  With my old TV I had my PS3 hooked up to my digital audio input of my Bose so I could watch BluRay disks in surround sound.  Everything else was hooked up stereo since there is only 1 digital input on the Bose.  This Sharp TV has a digital out as well, and according to the documentation you can hook up all of your external devices to it via HDMI and then use the digital audio out to your surround sound system.  I did this only to discover that Sharp, as well as most other TV manufacturers, do not send Dolby Digital signals out of the digital output of the TV if the signal comes from an external source (such as the HDMI input from DirecTV).  This completely defeats the purpose of having a digital audio out.  I believe Vizio, Sony and Toshiba TV's will pass the Dolby Digital signal through their digital audio out, but Sharp does not.  At least not on this TV.The other thing I discovered is that it also will not pass the Dolby Digital out from external sources from their Smart TV offerings such as Netflix and Hulu.  Again, completely defeats the purpose of having a digital output.  So unless I am capturing HD video and audio over the air and sending it through the digital output of this TV, the best audio I'll get is PCM 2.0.  Looks like I have to hook the PS3 back up to the Digital input of my Bose system and go back to using stereo connections from the Xbox, DirecTV, etc.This is really the only negative thing I could say about the TV, which is why I gave it 4 out of 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Everything You Expect

Like others, I've turned off all motion enhancements and am very happy with the set for sports events.  I have a 7.1 surround system I'm using with the set, so I don't care that the TV has crappy audio quality.  The fact this Sharp set has less smart features than others models was a plus for me - less to go wrong.

Reviews.Title: No complaints
Reviews.Author: David A Thomas
Reviews.Content: This TV was a big upgrade from my old rear projection television. I'm not super up to date on the latest TV's and features, but this one looks beautiful and was just the right price.

Reviews.Title: Cant beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Picture

Reviews.Content: Had this tv calibrated from best buy service tech. Made a huge difference would recommend doing this . Now have the wow factor on my tv

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money

Reviews.Content: The TV has a very good picture and a lot of features of a much higher priced unit.  My biggest complaint as with other reviews is the sound, it really needs some type of additional sound system to make it bearable.  Also refer to prior review for soap opera effect, it works.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture

Reviews.Title: Lucky Me

Reviews.Content: Sharp still has the best electronics anywhere and this TV is way super cool and I am such a happy camper. Best buy around.

Reviews.Title: I'd purchase again.

My only complaint, and a big one considering how bright the room is where it sits, is side viewing not good and lots of reflection.  I had a Samsung previously in its place which was much better.  He it been the same price at the time, I would have gone with the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice, Excellent Picture, Great Design, Nice Looking TV

Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent, nice looking cabinet.  Many inputs and wifi is working great.  Was going to go with Samsung but decided to go with the Sharp as it was $400 less.  Couldn't be happier, will probably get another for the basement.

Reviews.Author: R.N. "Stigmata"
Reviews.Content: Several other reviews mention the soap opera affect. It's like watching a home movie almost.  These TVs must be preset to display that way, and it's terribly annoying. Reviews.Title: Great TV

Reviews.Content: this is a great TV.  i now have 3 of them.  two in the office and one at home and could not be happier.  the only downfall i have found is that they just dont put out much sound.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality!!!

Reviews.Content: This TV has great quality, depending on the view mode you prefer it can be life like, vibrant, soap opera style, or just like a movie theater. Smart TV capabilities are fun to play with and easy to use.Truly recommend this TV.

So, I watch everything in game mode which doesn't have the same vivid color with pop as other settings. I have tried to calibrate it, but I can't get it where I want it. Other than that, the TV's features are good and quality is ok. If Sharp would allow me to turn off the motion smoothing, I'd probably give it a 4 star rating.

Maybe I could use some additional advice on adjusting the settings and capturing a crisp clear picture 100% of the time

Reviews.Title: 60 in aquios smart TV
Reviews.Author: Russ
Reviews.Content: It is a good TV so far. The picture is great,with a little tweaking.  Delivery was very good.  Like I said it is very good so far,  I will keep  you posted.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Jason J. Spaetti "Casual Techie"
Reviews.Content: I've been waiting to upgrade to a 60" TV for two years.  I waited and waited, research and researched.  This TV is a great non-3D display, with plenty of settings to adjust to get the picture the way you like it.  I'm no videophile, so I'm sure there are TVs with better picture quality, but in two years of putting eyeballs on various plasmas, LCDs, and LEDs in this price range on display in stores, this one immediately grabbed my attention.  I didn't need a Smart TV, but I did set up Netflix so my wife could use it without having to involve my Playstation.  Netflix was easy to setup and looks great streaming HD.  If you catch it for $1,000 or less, it's a fantastic deal.

Reviews.Title: sharp  Sharp
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. Mccrea
Reviews.Content: this is an awesome tv with a great picture and more features then I have figured out so far.  I highly recommend it to anyone wanting a bigscreen with beautiful color. The price was right, delivery was quick and it was a merry Christmas!!!

Reviews.Title: Summary of Review
Reviews.Author: Timothy Liu
Reviews.Content: The tv has excellent picture quality. The smart feature was poor and difficult to use for internet, especially the key board.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased

Reviews.Content: Excellent TV --- no need for more at my age. The direct internet access is very nice. Picture quality is all we could hope for. The delivery was a pleasant surprise -- opening it up and setting it up was smooth and a plus. The TV has MANY input ports; including USB. The TV sound is weak but it didnt matter as I had it hooked up to surround sound.I have been using the Smart App every day - Netflix and Youtube. You should try out Youtube pairing with your tablet or Smartphone. The web browser is hard to navigate and I stopped using it.All in all 1 month in I am very happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Grate T V

Reviews.Content: This is my second Sharp as I  also own a 40" Aquos 120HZ Smart HDTV had it two years, love it also this new 60" model is just the right size for our 20' X 20' living room couldn't ask for a better picture

Reviews.Title: excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Gloria S. Brotchner
Reviews.Content: Just what we wanted!  It has a web browser as well as sharp, clear visuals and should be trouble-free for years to come.  Amazon made the choice easy- great price, great delivery option, all in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: Finally figured out how to reboot TV without unplugging TV
Reviews.Author: Keith Ho "Amazon Shopper"
Reviews.Content: Sometimes the apps "freezes" the TV.  This happens a few times a week when I'm watching content from USB or Media stream from my home network.  I called customer service and they told me to "unplug" the TV.  I thought this was a primitive solution.  The user manual didn't specify how to reset the TV.  I just accidentally discovered how to reset/reboot.  Just press and hold the on/off button on the TV for 5 seconds.  The TV will reset automatically and reboots from start.  If you do it from the remote, it will not work.  Problem solved.Other thoughts:  I enjoy using and watching this TV for the past 6 months.  Picture quality is excellent.  Youtube is great!  Great thing about watching Youtube is that the commercials are almost non-existent.  Maybe it's a contractual thing with Youtube and Sharp.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant Picture
Reviews.Author: Cat
Reviews.Content: Went to several stores to check out the TV options in person. Loved this one and bought from Amazon because it was the best price, FREE SHIPPING, and a better extended warranty price. Only negative is the sound quality but pugged the stereo into the TV (yes it has that feature also) and it is perfection. I would recommend this product for price, quality, and features.Wallpaper feature is a nice plus!

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality for a great price!
Reviews.Author: Just me
Reviews.Content: Love this TV. It is very thin and has a great picture. If you haven't seen some of the new hd led tvs in action, I would recommend checking them out at a box store before, because the quality of the picture was almost too strong for some of the family.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, TV not as Smart as expected, integrated web browser functionally deficient for viewing tv episodes online
Reviews.Author: Pamela S. Campbell
Reviews.Content: I have been using the TV for about a week now. The TV has a very nice picture. My only disappointment so far is that the integrated web browser is not as full function as expected. I tried to watch past episodes of shows from abc.com. The picture will not fill the full screen and squeezes down narrower such that the proportions are off (tall/thin people/objects). Also, when the point in the episode is reached where an ad is shown, the ad does not play and the show never resumes. I asked Sharp if they would be updating the browser to resolve these deficiencies, but received no answer other than the web browser isn't full function.Thus, my assumption is they have no plans. I would think they would integrate a standard browser such as Chrome rather than implementing their own proprietary browser. Using the integrated web browser for viewing past episodes was what I believed to be one of the advantages of this Sharp TV as I would no longer need to connect my laptop to the TV. Unfortunately, this is not the case :-(

Reviews.Title: Reliable product
Reviews.Author: Sharon Miao
Reviews.Content: The quality of the product is consistent. We are still learning to use the different features of the TV. We are happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: A+++
Reviews.Author: Amber0187
Reviews.Content: After looking around at local stores we fell in love with this TV. The picture is beautiful. It's super thin. Mounts to the wall beautifully!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Spunk "DaveN"
Reviews.Content: 1/2 the price I paid for my rear projection 65" in 2002 and a million times better picture. Picture is perfect from every angle and tv is easy to hook up. No sales tax and got it in less than a week........

Reviews.Title: great item
Reviews.Author: jason from indy
Reviews.Content: love this TV. Colors are great. The only complaint is the sound could be a little better. But with a sound bar it sounds great. Purchased this 60 tv to replace a 46 Sharp tv that we have had for 4 years. Moved the 46 inch upstairs and hung the 60 inch above fireplace. Looks very nice. Colors are very bright and picture is clear from odd angles as well. We went with the Sharp, becuase with my experience, they last. I have purchased 3, 65 inch Sharps for at work and one of them has been on non stop for about 4 years now and no problems. The other one is going on 6 years old and have no problems as well. The last one i purchased for work is only about 2 1/2 years old. I have also purchased a RCA and a Dynex for work and the picture on the Sharp blows those out of the water. The price for this 60inch was right at the price I wanted to spend. Plus it is a smart tv, so netflix on it is a plus. Kids are always trying to take the remote from me to watch cartoons.

Reviews.Title: Okay after the return
Reviews.Author: Sue Light
Reviews.Content: Had issues with the first one, had to have it replaced, second one is ok, Wish I had looked a bit longer I would have purchased another brand, one that was not as dark.

Reviews.Title: best overall price picture support size
Reviews.Author: lucke3er
Reviews.Content: Bought mine at best buy for little less but was an opened box item for the first two weeks this tv did everything i could ever dream of watching breaking bad season 5 and my favorite movies born to race,fast an furious, and so on paired this with my samsung sound bar and i seriously got people saying my living rooms feels like being at an imax. Even throwing a breaking bad party this sunday!Pros, awesome tv, huge, slim, sounds good, nice featuresCons mine got a red line through it, and the remote is sensitive.I sent the picture to sharp they were amazing enough to upgrade my tv to the next model up 75eu and which is just amazing for a company to give me a tv worth quite a bit more. Im very happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Bautifull TV
Reviews.Author: Quan Nguyen
Reviews.Content: It nice TV, only problem that the smart funtion does not work very well it limit to many funtion from internet like no flash to get some movie.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Choongki Lee
Reviews.Content: Wow Great tv. Nice price and appearance. Sharp is the best tv maker i think. I recommend this tv to everyone.

Reviews.Title: quality tv
Reviews.Author: william kerman
Reviews.Content: great tv for the price, love the smart features, easy set up, sound a little weak needs sound bar or suround sound

Reviews.Title: Untimely Demise...
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: Two Months after the warranty expired on my 70 inch Sharp Aquos , vertical thin lines appeared on the screen. They are about an inch apart and they cover the entire screen. Other reviewers have complained about this. It appears this is not an isolated incident. I’ve tried unplugging and resetting but to no avail. It looks like I will have to call a service tech. I just hope it doesn’t cost as much as a new TV!Take this into consideration before you decide to buy a Sharp.

Reviews.Title: Was Great For 3 months  & heres Why..
Reviews.Author: LAVENDER "P. S."
Reviews.Content: I was thinking  Hmmm  Sharp is  The Best,And It was for 3 Months,,,,I only Moved it ONCE…. Very Very Carefully….I guess  Sharp  is Sensitive ?Anyways  One day I was Planning to watch a Dvd I just Bought.I turned on The Tv,  colored Lines  ( Real Pretty ones  Haaaa)  gotta joke or Ill Cry,Anyways,I have 4 Year warranty  on it,Called  it  & they Said to e mail them a Picture  of  it  WHICH I DID,took 5 Days to get a AnswermCalled them Back  & they said It was DAMAGED  HMMMM WHAT?thats Funny.  Only Moved It 2 Feet…I have No  Kids,I watched It  Every Night,it was Off In day time,,,So Now  They said I have to pay 8 Hundred Bucks  & they will bring me a Used 60 Inch  Tv.what a Joke and a Half….Please Be aware Of What Is What,,,Im Not saying its not a Good Tv, Its who I was Dealing with,,,,,Live N learn I guess,No More Sharp for Me……Ill Live with the Used One they Bring…Then a Sony Or any Kind…If goes Out Again……….I have  No Company  either,So I dunno  Live N learn  …Please Be Carefull ….

Reviews.Title: Wonderful picture
Reviews.Author: Katherine J Oppenheimer
Reviews.Content: We were completely surprised at how beautiful the picture is on this TV. As Visio owners, we were pleased with our experience, but in the future, we will purchase Sharp. White glove delivery was wonderful. The delivery guys moved our old TV, unboxed the new one, put in on our stand, attached the cable box, and cleaned the area. Wow!

Reviews.Title: tv is great would give it 5 stars but for a few small problems
Reviews.Author: Bobby Faulkner
Reviews.Content: first i got a 55 inch samsung 3d tv about two months ago from amazon and the picture is pristine and fabulous no complaints decided to upgrade to something a little bigger and read nothing but great reviews about this tv and read that anything over 60 should be a sharp because of the color quality I will have to say the samsung picture is way better dont get me wrong it has a great picture but the samsung tv picture just looks better MAYBE i need to tweek the color i dont know will continue to play around with it other than that i would of given it five stars

Reviews.Title: Great overall, serious sound problems
Reviews.Author: 007 "cmyth007"
Reviews.Content: Very nice TV overall, with a few small'ish complaints. The picture is great. Setup with the internet was easy as pie and it streams my content from my home network and other computers with ease. I have virtually no complaints about anything with this TV, aside from the sound....I was told that the sound quality on these new, large TV's was bad. As TV's get thinner, the quality of the speakers suffers. This is certainly understandable. But what really blew me away was how loud it was BEHIND the tv. Yes. It is incredibly loud behind the TV, more so than in front, I think. So when I have the volume up, it blasts through the rest of the house instead of toward me on the couch. It is very irritating. The quality of the sound, though, is actually not as bad as some reviewers have said. I think it sounds reasonably good, it's just going in the wrong direction!The other option I may try is to attach the optional sound bar. What I don't know is if you can bypass the TV speakers completely when using this option. If so, I'd buy them tomorrow because this is really annoying. If any of you know the answer to this, please let me know!Aside from the sound, this is a darn good TV. Setup was a snap, streaming is gorgeous and effortless and it has PLENTY of extra connection options in the back for all of your devices. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: It doesn't get any better!
Reviews.Author: Keith Harris
Reviews.Content: I'm a believer that Sharp has nixed the market when it come to TV sizes larger than 50". This TV is incredible and fits my personal need. I can't wait for football and basketball season.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I finally got this TV yesterday (May 28th). After I got it set up (which was really easy) I love the picture. Great colors and extremely clear picture. I strongly recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Horrible tv
Reviews.Author: ooha
Reviews.Content: 1.The picture is dull compared to the panasonic 50 inch that I was planning to replace.2.the picture had to be adjusted many times to remove the soap opera look3. The voice and picture don't sync - this happens randomly4. The audio out and the tv audio have a time lag. So you hear echoing effect using an external ampThis is a horrible tv

Reviews.Title: Nice tv
Reviews.Author: max
Reviews.Content: This tv has a very crisp image and the built in apps work very well. It was not too difficult to configure it for a home network.

Reviews.Title: Better than described..
Reviews.Author: Danny Buentello
Reviews.Content: Can't believe the quality of the picture.  A great buy.  You can do no better for the $$$.  Lives up to reviews..

Reviews.Title: Are We At the Movies
Reviews.Author: YG
Reviews.Content: What a great picture quality.  I purposefully sit on the loveseat which gies a side view of the tv.I can see the picture just fine. It waseasy setup.  I would recommend that Amazon instant videos app be added

Reviews.Title: Sweet TV
Reviews.Author: Nathan Risto
Reviews.Content: Got to say I was really impressed with this TV for it's size at the price point. It was my in-laws who actually received the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great value
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Lipple
Reviews.Content: This TV gives a fantastic image. It required a little bit of adjustment, i used Disney's blu ray calibration disk (http://www.amazon.com/Disney-WOW-World-Wonder-Blu-ray/dp/B0045ASBLG). Just using it out-of-the-box i was losing detail in extreme whites/blacks.Sometimes on an all black screen I can see slightly "whiter" areas where the backlight is brighter but it is impossible to see if there is any content whatsoever on the screen so it doesnt bother me. I want to stress how hardly visible these spots are, product still gets a 5/5 from me.

Reviews.Title: bad picture and glare
Reviews.Author: Tina Coppock
Reviews.Content: I already had a 52 inch Sharp and thought this 60 inch would be just as good.  It is NOT.  The picture quality is not nearly as good as my 52 inch (I have tried adjusting the picture settings numerous times to no avail). I also have two big windows in the room and there is a constant glare on the screen.  I did not have this problem with my other Sharp. While the picture is a little better at night, it is still not nearly as good as my other TV. I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: A very good product, misses some little features...
Reviews.Author: Federico Francioni
Reviews.Content: ... like a turning/rotating base, cause it's pretty heavy to lift and turn every time.Smart Central is a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: After shopping around in this price range for a few weeks, I am very pleased with this TV. Picture is great, the TV is very slim and lightweight for a 60 inch, and the Smart options are definitely nice to have. Like with many others who have written reviews, you should go into the advanced settings and make a few adjustments to get rid of the soap opera effect. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tv!! This is my second one.
Reviews.Author: Jesse Ramirez
Reviews.Content: I've had my TV now for one week and love it. Fix the Soap Opera problem as recommend by other reviews and now picture is awesome even after the updates. Of course everyone is different and setting up thier tv will be different. Really a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: ld
Reviews.Content: This is a truly wonderful television. the picture is great as well as the smart tv functions. The only issue is the speakers are on the bottom of the television facing down so the volume has to be turned way up to hear it.

Reviews.Title: U can't bet it
Reviews.Author: Lee First "la1st"
Reviews.Content: I love it great color pic nice remote need to by a sound bar ( Bose )  then u b set

Reviews.Title: BAD BOY MONSTER
Reviews.Author: Enrique. B
Reviews.Content: This is the centerpiece to our basement and it is STUNNING. Have it hooked up to an HDMI matrix that runs to the 42" at the bar. NO DEGREDATION OF SOUND OR PICTURE. The soap opera issue was solved easily and without problem. The ONLY complaint I have is that the wi-fi receiver in the TV is VERY weak. My router is centrally located and I have two other TVs in the basement that are linked to the same router. This TV has issues with signal strength and I have failed to connect. Amazon support helped me but I need a wi-fi extender I guess. Amazon even BEAT the price on a competing site AND I got a rebate of 2% which paid for a BluRay player. CAN'T BEAT THAT.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Excellenct TV. Exactly what I wanted. Perfect picture great color. All the smart features work great. The browser isn't real great for some things but it does the job. All around great tv though.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY SHARP - HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE
Reviews.Author: Aram Mirzadeh "aram535"
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICEThe TVs these days are not made like they used to be.  You won't hang on to your TV very long so customer service is very important.  Having recently purchased a 60" Aquos I was very sad to hear that the unit had to be replaced completely, even more when they told me that it took take up to 3 WEEKS+ to replace.  I had the problem on a Monday, Called in Tuesday and didn't even wait for the email (which came the day latter) I photographed and emailed Sharp with the information they wanted.  4 days after  that I called in to check and they were just getting approval for the replacement -- and IF they approved it, it would take another 7-10 business days to ship a unit to Long Island (NY).  Right around Thanksgiving and Christmas ... which means I'll be out of a TV for a month+.  I called and called they had nothing for me, except this is now our process and has been for a while, nothing we can do to change it.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: BA
Reviews.Content: Easy setup and operation. Web browser is fairly useless and clumsy to use. The super Bowl was great on the set(unless you were a Denver fan)

Reviews.Title: Smart functions really bad
Reviews.Author: Ernest Scinto
Reviews.Content: As a TV it's fine. Picture is good. Sound is good. But the Smart functions are just terrible. Takes minutes to switch between a video signal and Netflix. Sometimes it doesn't work and you need to turn it off before you can get into Netflix. Buy a different one if that's what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for (Updated Rating)
Reviews.Author: Uranus Speaks "Uranus"
Reviews.Content: It's "GOOD" in the world of large screen LED HD TVs, especially for the price.-  Presentation of human faces is slightly harsh, like too much contrast, and looks like a TV picture rather than realistic facial presentation one would expect viewing 1080P resolution.-  The overall picture quality and viewing experience is slightly inferior to that of the Quattron version of Sharp's products, but that's about a $1000 upgrade.In conclusion, the Sharp LC-70LE650 70-inch Aquos 1080p is GOOD for the price, but when compared to the older Sharp Aquos LC-70LE732U, there is a picture richness penalty.

Reviews.Title: Mostly Good
Reviews.Author: ezra zalayet
Reviews.Content: Great TV but there have been some issues with the sound.  Once in a while it gets out of sync with the video and sometimes even gets static-y.  But it only happened a few times and may be cleared up.

Reviews.Title: Nice!...
Reviews.Author: Gene K. (aka Tyronious Ledbedder Beaver-Bottom)
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived when it was scheduled, it was in perfect condition and the delivery guys were very pleasant and friendly. At first I was somewhat disappointed by what I will call " motion artifacts", with the picture looking as if everything had been filmed with a handheld camera.  I am familiar with the Soap Opera Affect, but this was somewhat different than that. However, since I had connected the TV with a Cat 5 to my network when I set it up, it immediately told me that a software update was available. I somewhat reluctantly clicked "OK" and the update downloaded quickly and was applied flawlessly. And after some additional adjustments the picture is great!  As with any high quality HDTV, the picture is only as good as the source material, so with both cable and streaming sources the picture quality varies a bit from program to program. I am looking into having it professionally calibrated, as I think that will make it even better. I will post an update if and when I get that done.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: Bill Gatewood Jr.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace a 50" plasma.  i was looking at the 640 but saw the 650 had just been released.  The picture is exceptional, the smart functions are robust and the initial setup was simple.  So far, I am very impressed.  When watching sports during the last few days, I almost thought I had a front row seat.

Reviews.Title: Lousy wireless connectivity
Reviews.Author: Rajendra Kanuru
Reviews.Content: The remote is a bit more complicated than necessary. Also, it gets lousy wi-fi signal. All other devices and another smart tv I have work easy with good internet signal from my router. This tv can't pick the signal up at all. I have to use my roku box to get streaming content on the tv, which defeats the purpose of buying a smart tv. Called service and their only advice was to try buying a signal booster or relocating my router within 10 feet of the tv. If having wireless internet feature on the tv important to you don't get this tv.

Reviews.Title: I wish I din't install those updates
Reviews.Author: newvoodoo "newvoodoo"
Reviews.Content: The TV as hardware is fine and met my expectations. What exceeded my expectation is that you can update the firmware with a click of a button.. if only those updates made sense. After the last update my TV got slower, sometimes just unresponsive, my Logitech wireless keyboard stopped working, and after smoking some substance they decided that typing a text using on screen keyboard is better with a single lines of keys instead of a matrix. But hey, why would you use on screen keyboard if you can use your cell phone to type? mmmmmm..... why would I use a TV if I can watch it on a cell phone?

Reviews.Title: Poor design quality (audio delay, bad backlighting, soap opera effect)
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to say I returned the costco version (LC60C6500U) of this model today. It has lots of features, but... there are a few glaring issues.1) The soap opera effect is present in every mode except game mode. So why pay for 1120Hz refresh when you have to disable all of the 'advanced' features?2) This model had a terrible issue after watching any source of HD video after about 1-2hours the audio would lag the video by over 1 second! This is a deal breaker for me. How can anyone tolerate this? It is like watching old badly dubbed kung-fu movies. How can this pass any quality testing at Sharp? How can the engineers design such an abomination? Very bad job Sharp, shame on you. Yes, I tried to updated the firmware, no change.3) This particular model is apparently edge lit with LEDs. Well, when watching credits after a movie the credit text will exhibit streaking on the screen immediately right of the text on a black background. This is the easiest way to see this problem. It is a very poor back lighting scheme.I was happy to get this TV and use it at first. The 'smart' features I barely used and were not too smart.I am so glad to be rid of this thing. I switched to a 50" plasma and the picture is a world better! Be careful about looking at a screen in a well lit big box warehouse. They generally have excessively back-lit content that does not show black level issues. You also will not see the audio delay issue here.I am hopeful that Sharp can get their grindstone out and sort these problems out by sharpening up on their embedded software and hardware development engineering skills. Guys, you are not looking too sharp with this model.

Reviews.Title: SHARP IS QUALITY
Reviews.Author: Sharon Ables
Reviews.Content: ONE DAMN GOOD PICTURE SO I WILL KEEP IT FOR A LONG TIME THE DELIVERY WAS OK BUT THEY DIDN'T WANT TO OPEN IT BUT THEY DID AFTER I INSTITED

Reviews.Title: Great Delivery
Reviews.Author: J. S. Nelson
Reviews.Content: After ordering the TV we were given a delivery date and a time frame. Pilot Delivery was excellent as they delivered on time, were very nice and unpacked the TV and verified it worked correctly.  As for the TV, I have had it a day and all seems good.  The picture is great.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Jeff Malott
Reviews.Content: This is my first LED over 55 inches, and I'm very impressed with the picture.  Along with the size, the price point was the original attaction.  Time will tell how long the value stands.  The family likes it right now!

Reviews.Title: So far so good, except for the stand!!
Reviews.Author: Bethel mom "ReaderWriter'nMom"
Reviews.Content: Well, the TV seems good, but we thought we'd put it on the stand until we get a wall mount up. Don't do it! This thing is so flimsy the pets could knock the TV over. We had to leave it on the floor with a couch propped up against it to hold it up. Yes, it's all screwed in.

Reviews.Title: Warped Bezel?
Reviews.Author: robk64
Reviews.Content: This was a manufacturer warranty replacement for the 640u that started to have LED bleed-thru on the bottom of the screen.  The screen itself is noticeably more reflective than the 640u, but what really has me concerned is the top of the TV.  Looking from one side, across the top, to the other side, the TV bows out.  It's mounted on the wall, and the wall mount brackets are flush (not canted which might induce the bending).  Strangely enough, the TV still works, even with the bend.  Not sure how long that will last, though.  It took 8 months for the light bleed-throughs to appear on the bottom of the 640u.  At $300 less than what I paid for the 640u, I'm not sure if the 650u is a better buy, or just a lighter-weight, cheaper version of the same TV.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: tommygun
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this purchase. Love the ability to use phone with tv. I was able toount solo its so light remote is ok.

Reviews.Title: TV Sucks
Reviews.Author: Ruth Mitchell
Reviews.Content: Purchased the TV less than 6 months ago and it broke. The picture started to get distorted until we had no picture but just a bunch of discoloring on tv not able to distinguish anything on it.  Called Sharp to try to get it fixed its been already 3 weeks and my tv still not fixed. Horrible customer service and no one is able to help. Very disappointed overall experience.

Reviews.Title: Terrible TV... DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Jake Vigliotti
Reviews.Content: TV is a piece of garbage.  Sharp's "help" was useless.Short version; TV worked for 23 hours, then it 'locked up'.  A factory reset didn't fix it, so called Sharp.  The hard re-boot (holding down buttons on TV with it unplugged) got it working, but the "Smart" features then suddenly stopped feeding audio out to the receiver.  Sharp couldn't fix it, and even hung up on me after 25 minutes on hold.Default settings are dumb; defaults to "Film" - which makes video look choppy.  Default color schemes are too bright, you really have to tinker with it to correctly set it.  "Smart" features are difficult to set up; even the Sharp rep told me on the phone not to set it up the way the on-screen instructions tell you to.There's nothing more annoying than boxing up a TV and sending it back, but that's what I did.  Giant waste of 10 days for me... tried everything to get it back to as it was the first day, but nothing worked.  Save yourself the hassle; buy a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Red line down the screen!
Reviews.Author: David Shane Grieb
Reviews.Content: I have contactaced Sharp after attempting to fix it over the phone and photos sent they will replace with a new one. It has been in transit for over 10 days and still not here.

Reviews.Title: LAG
Reviews.Author: BRIAN R.
Reviews.Content: On 1300x768 I don't really have an issue playing games via hdmi, but when I kick it up to 1080p this thing has like a 59ms input lag which makes gaming completely impossible. There is no "Game mode" on this tv that I can find, and I bought this tv primarily to play games from the living room. If I could give it 0 stars I would.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV depending in your use
Reviews.Author: Katrina F
Reviews.Content: I got this TV as I was told it would be fine for gaming on, and unfortunately that isn't the case. My boyfriend likes to play Madden and NHL on our PS3 and this tv just couldn't keep up. You should see the puck jump across the screen instead of gliding smoothly (sometimes leading to the other team scoring because of it). Same thing would happen on Madden when the ball was thrown. We ended up returning it because even on one of the playoff games it had an issue. If you're a basic tv watcher and don't play video games this tv is for you. However if you are looking to take full advantage of it, look elsewhere. We ended up going with the sharp 60LE755 (I think that's it) and it's been great. Even got a PS4 now and haven't had a single issue.

Reviews.Title: knarly raw view
Reviews.Author: derek sippy
Reviews.Content: freaking love it far exceeded expectations just needed more screen size adjustments  and the sharpness feature under the menu adjustments gets way too sharp turned all the way up other than that raw and stupid fresh good work.

Reviews.Title: Not as big as you think
Reviews.Author: Daniel Konkel
Reviews.Content: I found it to be a great unit at a great price the picture is great as is the sound

Reviews.Title: Sharp 70
Reviews.Author: Vincent Fernandez
Reviews.Content: Great buy! TV requires a lot of time spent adjusting settings. Everything had "soap opera" look to it with factory settings. Smart features and picture after adjusting settings are great, sound is not the best quality.all in all very happy. Saved couple hundred through Amazon, no sales tax or shipping.

Reviews.Title: OVERPRICED, SELLING CHEAPER EVERYWHERE ELSE
Reviews.Author: PC
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the exact same model television for $899.99 after in-store credit at CostCo.com normal CostCo price is $999.99 but if you watch their special offers, I am sure this TV will be on sale again for the low price of $899.99. Why pay 100-200 dollars more when you're supposed to be getting it cheaper online than in the stores? I think amazon should adjust their pricing to be competitive with this.

Reviews.Title: Bad, but cheap?
Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: The picture makes even blu-ray movies look like cheap soap-opera video tape of last century.  The motion blur technology on a full picture scan looks okay, good in fact, but if a single character runs across the screen, his perimeter breaks apart like some cheap FX.  Same with rapid hand movements.  I suppose it's too late to exchange it for a Samsung?

Reviews.Title: TV missing threading for screws to attach the stand
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The stand that comes with the TV attaches via two legs. One of them is unable to attach because the metal part in the TV does not have any threading on one side. It looks like a simple problem with having the part improperly machined. One side is properly threaded and the stand will attach, and the other side has holes that are completely smooth inside instead of threaded. This prevents you from securely attaching the TV to the stand (just one leg of the stand will attach).This wouldn't be a problem if I knew that I would never want to use the stand. I was intending to wall mount this TV anyway, but I'd like the option of attaching the stand somewhere down the road. This seems like such a glaring oversight that it also gives me second thoughts about the TV in general.Now I have to box the thing back up and take it back to the store. I'm 50/50 on whether to get the same model or look at something different.

Reviews.Title: Headline
Reviews.Author: HaitianHova
Reviews.Content: The in-law wont leave my tv alone..lol... watching the HEAT WIN THE CHAMPION FOR A 2nd TYME IN A ROW ON IT Was WORTH THE MONEY SPEND lol love it man

Reviews.Title: Nice when it work
Reviews.Author: T. Pauley
Reviews.Content: First off we bought this refurbished from another site.  All of our televisions are refurbished and this is the first we've had issues with.  Within a few days we started getting lines down the picture, but because of our work schedules we didn't get the case started soon enough.  Sharp admits the television is not repairable, but they want us to pay an addition fee to replace this television with another refurbished one.  The additional fee would put our costs over the price of a new one.  I would stay away from this model (and Sharp as well to be honest) in the off chance you get a defective one like I did.  If you do, they won't stand by their product.

Reviews.Title: Shuts off every couple minutes
Reviews.Author: G Lyman
Reviews.Content: The t.v worked fine for awhile and now it continuously shuts off every 2 minutes and then turns back on.  It does this repeatedly.  I called Sharp about it.

Reviews.Title: Buyers Beware!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: kenneth oehmke
Reviews.Content: After dealing with my multiple Sharp Aquos TV's I will NEVER buy SHARP again. Subpar quality, horrible customer care. Please think twice before spending your hard earned money on a Sharp product. Shop around!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Worked for a while
Reviews.Author: Paul E. Marvin
Reviews.Content: piece of garbage... Worked just until the warranty expired.  Don't trust reviews from new buyers.  I would have rated this high as well initially but after seeing MANY others with similar complaints (motherboard failure) I would avoid Sharp products like the plague.

Reviews.Title: Online and netflix
Reviews.Author: Stephen J Dryer
Reviews.Content: I purchased smart tv so I could do streaming. It took many calls to sharp to finally get netflix to work. When it did many movies and series were not in HD clarity.  Missed entire Olympic steaming.

Reviews.Title: Just about satisfied
Reviews.Author: Asharma
Reviews.Content: Bought first 640U and then 650U and now planning to return for the second time for a Samsung. I already have Samsung 46" for the last five years and I guess once you get used to Samsung colors, sharp does not do the justice. I keep struggling to bring out the best colors on every channel as we flip between the Dish TV, Optimum, Netflix and DVD mode. Not sure if I am doing something wrong, but do not have the time every time to struggle with the best picture quality. Samsung is on the weekend to do list.

Reviews.Title: Hosed
Reviews.Author: Muhammad Khan
Reviews.Content: 2 Weeks after I purchased the TV, Amazon informed me that there had been a price reduction. They made me fill out a bunch of forms and nothing happened.I have 38 emails from them and each time I responded to them, I was told that this email doesn't accept messages!Why would you send me a message and then blow me off? This is how they treat PRIME customers!!!I was a huge fan of BEZOS but and I own stock in Amazon but I felt fuzzy when their stock took a hit !!!You don't get to keep customers in this manner and expect them to be your patron!!!

Reviews.Title: Worst picture ever!
Reviews.Author: Sipeish "SD mamma"
Reviews.Content: The TV itself is nice, the color however is horrible!! It seems the reds, and yellows are too prominent and stand out too much. The color, and quality also vary by show and it's freaking annoying! There's a foggy look to the picture that I can't fix even after adjusting the colors, and contrast. I hate that there's not swivel option like there was with my Samsung. I guess I'll be returning it and getting another Samsung tomorrow. I'd rather pay more for a Samsung than be stuck with this junk.
